intro: Mitriostigma barteri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, dark green leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often with a compact, bushy form. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial shade, making it a popular houseplant. Its ornamental value comes from its vibrant flowers, which can range in color from purple to white and pink.
